name: abnormal configuration of cerebral ventricles
description: Irregular or unusual shape of the cerebral ventricles, often indicating underlying pathology.

name: abnormal contour of calvarium
description: Deviations from the normal shape of the skull vault, possibly indicating cranial pathology.

name: abnormal odontoid process
description: Deviations in the shape or size of the odontoid process, affecting cervical stability.

name: abnormal septum pellucidum
description: Variations in the midline structure separating the lateral ventricles, linked with neural abnormalities.

name: abnormal ventricular configuration
description: Any deviation from normal ventricular shape or size, often indicative of neurological issues.

name: absent or minimally ossified vertebrae
description: Lack or reduction of normal vertebral ossification, often pointing to developmental abnormalities.

name: absent vertebral pedicle
description: The absence of one or more vertebral pedicles, potentially indicating spinal pathology.

name: acquired craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: Changes at the junction of skull base and cervical spine, usually due to disease or injury.

name: acquired fused vertebrae
description: Union of two or more vertebrae due to disease, trauma, or surgery.

name: acquired posterior neural arch defect
description: Loss of continuity in the posterior part of the vertebra, due to trauma or surgery.

name: acquired skull defect
description: Loss of bone in the skull, often due to trauma or surgical intervention.

name: agenesis or hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
description: Partial or complete absence of corpus callosum, often linked to neurodevelopmental disorders.

name: anisospondyly
description: Unequal vertebral heights, possibly due to growth disorders or congenital anomalies.

name: anophthalmia
description: Absence of one or both eyes, a rare congenital condition.

name: anterior beaked vertebrae in a child
description: Abnormal anterior protrusion of the vertebra, often seen in certain syndromes.

name: anterior third ventricle lesion
description: Abnormal mass or lesion located in the anterior part of the third ventricle.

name: anterior vertebral scalloping
description: Concave deformation of the front vertebral bodies, sometimes indicating pressure from adjacent structures.

name: asymmetrically enlarged lateral ventricles
description: Enlargement of one lateral ventricle compared to the other, could indicate various conditions.

name: atlantoaxial instability
description: Excessive movement at the junction between the atlas and axis, potentially dangerous to the spinal cord.

name: avascular intracranial mass
description: Intracranial mass without significant blood vessels, may indicate certain types of tumors.

name: avascular zone near the brain surface
description: An area near the brain surface lacking blood vessels.

name: basal ganglion calcification
description: Calcifications within the basal ganglia in the brain.

name: basilar cistern intense enhancement
description: Marked enhancement of the basilar cistern area on imaging.

name: basilar invagination
description: Upward displacement of the vertebral elements into the foramen magnum.

name: biconcave vertebra
description: Vertebrae with concave indentations superiorly and inferiorly.

name: biparietal bossing
description: Prominent projection of the parietal bones.

name: bone-in-bone vertebra
description: Vertebrae appearing as if a smaller bone is within a larger one.

name: brain ischemia secondary to extracranial lesion
description: Reduced blood flow to the brain due to a lesion outside the cranial cavity.

name: brain metastasis
description: Secondary malignant tumor in the brain originating from another site.

name: brain tumor in an infant
description: Neoplastic mass in the brain of an infant.

name: button sequestrum of skull
description: Focus of necrotic bone in the skull that becomes a small, isolated segment.

name: cerebellar dysgenesis
description: Abnormal development of the cerebellum.

name: cerebellar lesion
description: Abnormal area of tissue in the cerebellum.

name: cerebellar mass in a child
description: Abnormal growth in the cerebellum of a child.

name: cerebellar mass in an adult
description: Abnormal growth in the cerebellum of an adult.

name: cerebellopontine angle lesion
description: Abnormal area or mass located at the cerebellopontine angle.

name: cerebral arterial disease
description: Disease affecting the arteries in the brain.

name: cerebral embolism
description: Obstruction of a cerebral artery by an embolus.

name: cerebral gyriform calcification
description: Gyral pattern calcifications of the cerebral cortex.

name: cerebral infarction
description: Death of brain tissue due to inadequate blood supply.

name: cerebral vasculitis
description: Inflammation of the brain's blood vessel walls.

name: cerebral vessel wall irregularity
description: Abnormal contour or appearance of cerebral vessel walls.

name: cerebrospinal fluid rhinorrhea
description: Leakage of cerebrospinal fluid through the nose.

name: cerebrovascular malformation
description: Abnormality in the blood vessels of the brain.

name: cervical kyphosis
description: Abnormal forward curvature of the cervical spine.

name: cervical spine fusion
description: Surgical or congenital fusion of cervical vertebrae.

name: cherubic facies
description: Facial appearance characterized by round cheeks.

name: choroidal mass
description: Abnormal mass in the choroid of the eye.

name: communicating hydrocephalus
description: Hydrocephalus where CSF flow is obstructed post the ventricles.

name: congenital atlantoaxial subluxation or instability
description: Incomplete or loose connection between atlas and axis from birth.

name: congenital brain malformation
description: Developmental anomaly of the brain present from birth.

name: congenital craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: Birth defect in the junction between skull base and cervical spine.

name: congenital fused vertebrae
description: Congenitally joined vertebrae, often without a disc space.

name: congenital hydrocephalus
description: Hydrocephalus present at birth due to congenital factors.

name: congenital macrocephaly
description: Abnormally large head or cranial size from birth.

name: congenital narrow spinal canal
description: Abnormally small spinal canal present from birth.

name: congenital posterior neural arch defect
description: Developmental defect of the neural arch in vertebrae.

name: congenital premature craniosynostosis
description: Premature fusion of skull sutures at birth.

name: congenital vertebral abnormality
description: Developmental anomalies in the vertebral column.

name: coronal cleft vertebrae
description: Vertebral cleft in the coronal plane, typically congenital.

name: cranial nerve paresis or paralysis
description: Partial or complete loss of cranial nerve function.

name: craniotubular dysplasia
description: Genetic disorders affecting the development of bones, particularly skull and long bones.

name: cranium bifidum
description: Defect in bone development leading to an opening in the skull.

name: cryptophthalmos
description: Congenital absence of eyelids causing skin to cover the eyes.

name: CSF-intensity brainstem lesion
description: Lesion at the brainstem showing fluid-like signal intensity on MR.

name: CSF-intensity extraaxial fluid collection
description: Fluid collection outside the brain parenchyma that appears like CSF on imaging.

name: CSF-intensity extracranial mass
description: Extracranial mass mimicking CSF signal characteristics on imaging.

name: CSF-intensity intramedullary lesion
description: Lesion within the spinal cord with CSF-like signal intensity.

name: CSF-intensity intraventricular mass
description: Intraventricular mass that resembles CSF in signal intensity.

name: CSF-intensity posterior fossa lesion
description: Lesion in the posterior fossa with signal similar to CSF on imaging.

name: CSF-intensity sellar/suprasellar lesion
description: Lesion in the sellar/suprasellar region with fluid-like signal properties.

name: CSF-intensity subarachnoid space lesion
description: Lesion in subarachnoid space with CSF-like signal intensity.

name: cuboid vertebrae
description: Vertebra with a cube-like shape, often due to compressed or malformed growth.

name: curvilinear intracranial calcification
description: Calcification within the skull exhibiting a curved line appearance.

name: cystic brain lesion
description: Fluid-filled lesion within the brain indicating potential pathology.

name: cystic brain tumor with mural nodule
description: Cystic tumor in the brain possessing a solid nodule within its wall.

name: decreased cerebral vascular transit time
description: Reduced speed of blood flow through the cerebral vasculature.

name: decreased cranial convolutional markings
description: Reduced visibility of folds and gyri patterns in the brain.

name: decreased intracranial vessel size
description: Reduction in diameter of blood vessels within the skull.

name: defective cranial ossification
description: Abnormal bone formation in the skull leading to defects.

name: degenerative and metabolic disorders
description: A group of disorders characterized by progressive degeneration or widespread metabolic anomalies.

name: delayed closure of fontanelles
description: A condition where the soft spots on an infant's head close later than usual.

name: demyelinating disease
description: Disorders characterized by damage to the myelin sheath surrounding nerve fibers in the brain and spinal cord.

name: dense intracranial calcification
description: Increased density areas within the cranial cavity due to calcium deposition.

name: dense or thick skull
description: Abnormally thick or dense cranial bones.

name: dense subchondral zone of vertebra
description: Increased bone density under the cartilage of a vertebra.

name: dense temporal bone lesion
description: A lesion in the temporal bone exhibiting increased density.

name: densely sclerotic vertebra
description: A vertebra displaying increased bone density.

name: diffuse demineralization of skull
description: Widespread reduction in bone mineral density of the skull.

name: diffuse gyriform meningeal enhancement
description: Widespread enhancement of the meninges following the contours of the gyri on MRI.

name: diffuse leptomeningeal enhancement
description: Widespread enhancement of the leptomeninges on imaging, indicating inflammation or infiltration.

name: diffusely dense calvarium
description: Widespread increased density throughout the calvarial bones.

name: diffusely dense skull base
description: The skull base is uniformly sclerotic or dense throughout.

name: diffusely small cord
description: The spinal cord is reduced in caliber throughout its length.

name: disk calcification
description: Calcium deposition within an intervertebral disk.

name: dural sinus thrombosis
description: The formation of a blood clot in one of the brain's dural venous sinuses.

name: dysmyelinating disease
description: Disorders characterized by abnormal myelin growth or structure.

name: dysplastic sella turcica
description: Abnormal shape or size of the sella turcica due to developmental disorders.

name: dysplastic vertebral pedicle
description: Abnormal development or structure of a vertebral pedicle.

name: echogenic brain lesion
description: A brain lesion that appears brighter on ultrasound imaging due to its composition.

name: elongated sella turcica
description: A sella turcica that appears longer than usual.

name: encephalitis and meningitis
description: Inflammation of the brain and meninges usually due to infection.

name: encephalocele/meningocele
description: Herniation of meningeal and brain tissues through skull defect.

name: encephalopathy
description: A disorder affecting brain function, structure, or both.

name: enhancing extraaxial intracranial mass
description: A mass located outside the brain parenchyma that enhances with contrast.

name: enhancing mass in cerebellopontine angle cistern
description: A contrast-enhancing mass located in the cerebellopontine angle cistern.

name: enhancing sellar lesion
description: A lesion in the sellar region that enhances with contrast.

name: enhancing spinal cord lesion
description: A lesion in the spinal cord that enhances with contrast.

name: enhancing suprasellar lesion
description: A lesion above the sella turcica that enhances with contrast.

name: enlarged brainstem
description: An increase in size of the brainstem.

name: enlarged foramen magnum
description: An increase in the size of the foramen magnum.

name: enlarged intervertebral foramen
description: An increase in size of the intervertebral foramen.

name: enlarged nerve roots
description: Thickening or enlargement of nerve roots.

name: enlarged superior ophthalmic vein
description: Dilation or enlargement of the superior ophthalmic vein, often related to increased intracranial pressure.

name: enlarged vertebrae
description: Increase in size of vertebrae compared to normal.

name: enlarged vertebral pedicle
description: An increase in size of the vertebral pedicle.

name: enlargement or erosion of sella turcica
description: Changes in size or destruction of the sella turcica bone.

name: ependymal enhancement
description: Contrast enhancement of ependymal lining, often related to infection or inflammation.

name: erosion of inner table of skull
description: Loss of bony cortex of the inner table of the skull.

name: erosion of sphenoid wing
description: Destruction or thinning of the sphenoid wing of the skull.

name: erosion of the petrous ridge, pyramid, or apex
description: Loss of bone density or structure in the petrous part of the temporal bone

name: erosion or widening of the internal auditory meatus
description: Pathological morphological changes in the bony canal of the internal auditory meatus

name: expansile bone lesion
description: A lesion causing abnormally increased size or shape of the bone

name: extra-axial lesion
description: A lesion located outside the brain parenchyma

name: extradural lesion with abnormal adjacent bone
description: A lesion outside the dura mater affecting adjacent bone structure

name: extradural lesion with normal adjacent bone
description: A lesion outside the dura mater without affecting adjacent bone

name: extradural spinal lesion
description: A lesion located outside the dural covering of the spinal cord

name: extramedullary intradural signal void
description: A lesion causing signal loss within the dura but outside the spinal cord

name: extraocular muscle enlargement
description: Increased size of one or more muscles that control eye movement

name: facial asymmetry
description: Uneven appearance or structure on different sides of the face

name: facial nerve palsy
description: Paralysis or weakness of the facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve

name: fetal cranial deformity
description: An abnormal shape or size of the cranial bones in a fetus

name: flat occiput
description: Flattened appearance of the back part of the skull

name: flattened vertebral pedicle
description: Loss of the normal contour of a vertebral pedicle

name: focal leptomeningeal enhancement
description: Localized area of enhancement involving the leptomeninges

name: focal vertebral sclerosis
description: Localized area of increased bone density within a vertebra

name: focally dense calvarium
description: Localized area of increased bone density in the skull cap

name: focally dense skull base
description: Localized area of increased bone density at the skull base

name: focally small spinal cord
description: Localized segment of reduced diameter of the spinal cord

name: fourth ventricle outlet obstruction
description: Blockage impeding cerebrospinal fluid flow out of the fourth ventricle

name: fourth ventricular lesion
description: Lesion located in the fourth ventricle of the brain

name: frontal bossing
description: Prominent, protruding forehead

name: generalized skull thinning
description: Overall reduction in the thickness of the skull bones

name: globe lesion
description: Lesion affecting the eye globe

name: gyriform cortical/subcortical T1 hyperintensity
description: MRI finding of gyriform hyperintensity on T1-weighted images in brain

name: gyriform cortical/subcortical T2 hypointensity
description: MRI finding of gyriform hypointensity on T2-weighted images in brain

name: hair-on-end pattern in skull
description: Radiographic pattern seen in the skull indicating marrow hyperplasia

name: hemimegalencephaly
description: Unilateral abnormal enlargement of one cerebral hemisphere

name: heterogeneous T1-hypointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion with variable intensity on T1-weighted MRI

name: heterogeneous T2-hyperintense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion with variable intensity on T2-weighted MRI

name: high-resistance internal carotid artery flow
description: Elevated resistance to blood flow in the internal carotid artery on Doppler ultrasound

name: homogeneous T1-hypointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion uniformly hypointense on T1-weighted MRI

name: homogeneous T2-hyperintense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion uniformly hyperintense on T2-weighted MRI

name: homogeneously enhancing intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion that enhances uniformly with contrast

name: hydrocephalus
description: Accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain ventricles

name: hydromyelia
description: Cystic dilation of the central canal of the spinal cord

name: hyperdense basilar cisterns
description: Increased density in the brain basilar cisterns on CT scan

name: hyperdense intracranial lesion
description: An intracranial lesion with increased density on CT images

name: hyperdense sellar lesion
description: Increased density lesion in the sellar region on imaging

name: hyperdense suprasellar lesion
description: Increased density lesion in the suprasellar region on imaging

name: hyperpituitarism
description: Excessive production of one or more of the anterior pituitary hormones.

name: hypodense brainstem lesion
description: An area of lower density in the brainstem indicating possible pathology.

name: hypodense sellar lesion
description: A low-density area in the sella turcica region suggestive of a lesion.

name: hypodense suprasellar lesion
description: A decreased density area above the sella turcica, indicating a lesion.

name: hypodense supratentorial lesion
description: An area of low density above the tentorium in the brain.

name: hypopituitarism
description: Reduced pituitary gland hormone production.

name: hypoplastic vertebral pedicle
description: Underdevelopment of a vertebral pedicle typically seen as a bony defect.

name: hypothalamic hamartoblastoma syndrome
description: A rare genetic disorder involving non-cancerous tumor-like growths in the hypothalamus.

name: hypothalamic lesion
description: A lesion occurring in the region of the hypothalamus.

name: incomplete ossification of cranial sutures
description: Delayed or incomplete bony growth along cranial sutures.

name: increased cranial convolutional markings
description: Prominent markings on the skull indicating increased convolutional development.

name: increased intracranial pressure
description: Condition marked by elevated pressure inside the skull.

name: increased intracranial vessel size
description: Enlargement of the blood vessels within the skull.

name: infratemporal fossa lesion
description: Lesion occurring in the infratemporal fossa region.

name: infratentorial intracranial tumor in a child
description: A tumor located below the tentorium in the brain of a child.

name: intermediate T1 intensity diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Diffuse abnormality in vertebral bodies with intermediate T1 signal intensity.

name: intervertebral disk calcification
description: Calcification within or around an intervertebral disk.

name: intracerebral hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the cerebral parenchyma.

name: intracranial arteriovenous shunting
description: Abnormal connection between cerebral arteries and veins causing shunting.

name: intracranial calcification
description: Calcium deposits within the cranial cavity.

name: intracranial fat
description: Presence of fat tissue within the cranial vault.

name: intracranial hypervascularity
description: Increased blood vessel formation or flow within the cranium.

name: intracranial lesion in an infant
description: Any abnormality within the brain of an infant.

name: intracranial lesion with hypointense ring
description: An intracranial lesion that appears with a dark ring on MRI.

name: intracranial MRI signal void
description: An area within the cranial vault that returns no signal on MRI scans.

name: intradural extramedullary spinal lesion
description: A spinal mass located within the dura but outside the spinal cord.

name: intramedullary spinal lesion
description: A mass or lesion within the spinal cord itself.

name: intraventricular lesion
description: Abnormal mass located within the ventricular system of the brain.

name: intraventricular signal void
description: Area in the ventricles appearing with no signal on MRI scans.

name: irregular foramen magnum
description: Abnormal shape or contour of the foramen magnum.

name: isodense intracranial lesion
description: A lesion in the brain that is of equal density to surrounding tissues on CT.

name: isodense sellar lesion
description: Mass near or in the sella turcica that appears similar in density to surrounding tissue.

name: isodense suprasellar lesion
description: A lesion above the sella turcica with isodensity on CT.

name: J-shaped sella turcica
description: A morphological variation of the sella turcica that appears J-shaped on imaging.

name: jugular foramen lesion
description: A lesion located at the jugular foramen.

name: lack of filling of intracranial vessels
description: Absence of contrast filling in brain vessels on imaging.

name: large anterior canal of a vertebral body
description: An abnormal enlargement of the anterior vertebral canal.

name: large foramen magnum
description: An abnormally broad foramen magnum opening.

name: large head in infant
description: Enlargement of the head size in an infant.

name: large orbit
description: An orbit that is larger than normal.

name: large vascular grooves of skull
description: Enlarged grooves on the skull indicating major vascular structures.

name: large ventricle in infant
description: Enlargement of the brain ventricles in infants, possibly indicating hydrocephalus.

name: large ventricles and sulci
description: Enlargement of both ventricular system and cortical sulci, suggesting brain atrophy.

name: lateral extraconal lesion
description: Lesion located outside the conus of the orbit, usually in the lateral compartment.

name: lateral ventricle body lesion
description: Abnormal mass in the body of the lateral ventricle.

name: lens dislocation
description: Displacement of the ocular lens from its normal position.

name: lens opacity
description: Clouding of the lens, commonly known as cataract.

name: leukodystrophy / leukoencephalopathy
description: Degenerative diseases affecting white matter in the brain and spinal cord.

name: linear meningeal enhancement
description: Enhanced meninges suggesting inflammation or pathology like meningitis.

name: localized bulge of the calvarium or scalp
description: Abnormal protrusion of the calvarium or scalp region.

name: localized gyriform meningeal enhancement
description: Pattern of enhancement in meninges following the convolutions of gyri.

name: localized skull thinning
description: Focal thinning of the skull bones.

name: localized sunburst pattern in skull
description: Radiating pattern seen on skull indicating vascular or tumorous processes.

name: low-velocity internal carotid artery flow
description: Decreased flow speed in the internal carotid artery, possible stenosis.

name: lytic vertebral lesion
description: Destructive lesion of a vertebra.

name: macrocephaly
description: Abnormally large head size, often indicating increased brain size or fluid.

name: macrophthalmia
description: Enlargement of the eyeball.

name: markedly enhancing intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial mass with significant contrast enhancement, indicative of scenarios like tumors or abscesses.

name: meningeal metastasis
description: Cancer spread to the meninges surrounding the brain and spinal cord.

name: metastasis to subarachnoid space
description: Spread of cancer to the subarachnoid space.

name: microcephaly
description: A condition where an infant's head is significantly smaller than expected.

name: microphthalmia
description: A developmental disorder causing one or both eyes to be abnormally small.

name: microspherophakia
description: Condition characterized by small, spherical lenses of the eye.

name: middle cranial fossa lesion
description: Any abnormal growth or area within the middle cranial fossa.

name: midline supratentorial lesion
description: An abnormal finding located in the midline above the tentorium in the brain.

name: minimal vertebral ossification
description: Reduced bone formation in the vertebrae.

name: minimally enhancing intracranial lesion
description: An intracranial lesion that shows subtle contrast enhancement.

name: moderately enhancing intracranial lesion
description: An intracranial lesion that shows moderate contrast enhancement.

name: multifocal intracranial lesions
description: Presence of multiple abnormal areas within the brain.

name: multiple collapsed vertebrae
description: Several vertebrae that have lost height due to collapse.

name: multiple intracranial calcification
description: Several areas of calcification present within the brain.

name: multiple intracranial enhancing lesions
description: Several intracranial lesions that show contrast enhancement.

name: multiple nerve tumors
description: Several neoplastic growths affecting the nerves.

name: muscular dystrophy
description: A group of diseases causing progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.

name: narrow intervertebral disk space
description: Reduced space between vertebral disks, often indicating degeneration.

name: narrow spinal canal
description: Condition where the spinal canal is abnormally narrow.

name: nasopharyngeal extension of intracranial neoplasm
description: When an intracranial tumor extends into the nasopharynx.

name: neck mass
description: A lump or growth in the neck.

name: neoplastic solitary intracranial mass
description: A single tumor within the brain.

name: nerve root enhancement
description: Increased contrast uptake by the nerve roots indicating pathology.

name: neurocutaneous syndrome
description: A group of genetic disorders affecting the nervous system and skin.

name: neuronal migration disorder
description: Developmental disorder caused by abnormal migration of neurons in the brain.

name: nonenhancing extraaxial mass
description: A mass located outside the brain parenchyma that does not show contrast enhancement.

name: nonenhancing mass in the cerebellopontine angle cistern
description: A mass in the CPA cistern that does not enhance with contrast.

name: nonenhancing pachymeningeal lesion
description: A lesion in the dura mater that does not enhance with contrast.

name: nonneoplastic solitary intracranial mass
description: A non-cancerous solitary mass within the skull.

name: obstructive hydrocephalus
description: A condition where fluid builds up in the brain due to blockage.

name: odontoid aplasia
description: Absence of the odontoid process of the axis.

name: odontoid hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the odontoid process of the axis.

name: omega sella
description: An omega-shaped enlarged sella turcica.

name: optic atrophy
description: Degeneration of the optic nerve leading to vision loss.

name: optic canal enlargement
description: Increased size of the optic canal, often associated with lesions.

name: optic nerve enlargement
description: Increased diameter of the optic nerve.

name: optic nerve lesion
description: A pathological change in the optic nerve.

name: optic nerve sheath lesion
description: A lesion affecting the sheath surrounding the optic nerve.

name: optic nerve tram-track sign
description: MRI/CT finding indicative of optic nerve sheath meningioma.

name: orbital wall lesion
description: A lesion located at the bony boundary of the orbit.

name: osseous paranasal sinus lesion
description: A bone-related lesion in the paranasal sinuses.

name: pachymeningeal enhancement
description: Contrast enhancement of the dura mater.

name: papilledema
description: Swelling of the optic disc due to increased intracranial pressure.

name: parasellar calcification
description: Calcification in the parasellar region, often associated with craniopharyngiomas or meningiomas.

name: parasellar lesion
description: Abnormal growth or mass in the region adjacent to the sella turcica.

name: parasellar signal void
description: Area in the parasellar region showing lack of signal on MR, possibly indicating blood flow or air.

name: paraspinal soft-tissue mass
description: Soft-tissue mass located adjacent to the spinal column.

name: parenchymal brain hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the brain parenchyma.

name: periventricular hypodense lesion
description: Area of decreased density near the ventricles, often indicating edema or infarct.

name: periventricular T2 hyperintense lesion
description: An area adjacent to the ventricles that appears bright on T2-weighted MR images, suggestive of demyelination or gliosis.

name: pineal region lesion
description: Abnormal mass or lesion located near the pineal gland.

name: platyspondyly
description: Flattening of the vertebral bodies, frequently part of skeletal dysplasia syndromes.

name: pneumocephalus
description: Presence of air within the cranial cavity.

name: posterior fossa cystic lesion
description: Cystic abnormality located in the posterior fossa.

name: posterior fossa lesion
description: Abnormal mass located in the posterior fossa area of the brain.

name: posterior fossa tumor in a child
description: Tumor in the posterior fossa region common in pediatric populations (e.g., medulloblastoma).

name: posterior lateral ventricle lesion
description: An abnormality or mass near the posterior horn of the lateral ventricle.

name: posterior skull base lesion
description: Abnormal mass located at the base of the skull at the posterior aspect.

name: posterior third ventricle lesion
description: Mass or abnormality in or around the posterior aspect of the third ventricle.

name: posterior vertebral scalloping
description: Indentation or scalloping seen on the posterior aspect of vertebral bodies.

name: premature craniosynostosis
description: Early closure of one or more cranial sutures in infants.

name: primary brain tumor
description: Tumor originating from brain tissue (e.g., glioblastoma, astrocytoma).

name: prolonged cerebral vascular transit time
description: Delay in blood flow through cerebral vessels, potentially due to stenosis or occlusion.

name: prominent occiput
description: Prominent enlargement or protrusion of the occipital bone.
synonyms: any descriptive phrase indicating an enlarged occipital bone

name: radiolucent skull lesion
description: An area in the skull that appears darker on an X-ray, indicating lower density.

name: retinopathy
description: A disease of the retina resulting in impairment or loss of vision.

name: retrobulbar mass
description: A soft tissue mass located behind the eyeball.

name: ring-enhancing intracranial lesion
description: A brain lesion characterized by a ring of enhancement, often indicating necrosis or capsule formation.

name: round vertebrae
description: Vertebrae with unusual, circular shape.

name: sacral agenesis or hypoplasia
description: Partial or complete absence of the sacrum.

name: sacral deformity
description: Abnormal shape or formation of the sacrum.

name: sacrococcygeal appendage
description: A tail-like structure present at the sacrococcygeal region.

name: sacrococcygeal mass
description: A mass located at the sacrococcygeal region.

name: sacroiliac joint disease
description: Pathological condition affecting the sacroiliac joint.

name: salivary gland lesion
description: An abnormal mass or area in a salivary gland.

name: sclerosis of the orbital roof
description: Increased bone density of the orbital roof.

name: sellar lesion
description: An abnormality in the sella turcica, often affecting the pituitary gland.

name: separation of cranial sutures in a child
description: Widening or gapping of cranial sutures, usually seen in infants.

name: sinonasal mass with bony erosion
description: Soft tissue mass in sinuses with evidence of bony erosion.

name: sinonasal mass with bony remodeling without erosion
description: Sinonasal mass causing bony changes but no erosion.

name: sinonasal mass without bone changes
description: Soft tissue mass in the sinus not affecting bone structure.

name: skull asymmetry
description: Unequal shape or structure of skull halves.

name: skull base hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the base of the skull.

name: skull base lesion
description: Abnormal tissue or mass located at the base of the skull.

name: skull metastasis
description: Secondary malignant lesions in the skull resulting from spread of cancer.

name: small anterior fontanelle
description: Reduction in size of the anterior fontanelle in infants.

name: small cerebral ventricles
description: Decreased size of the cerebral ventricles in the brain.

name: small foramen magnum
description: Reduction in size of the foramen magnum, the large opening at the base of the skull.

name: small intervertebral foramen
description: Narrowing of the openings between the bones of the spine where nerves exit.

name: small optic canal
description: Decreased size of the bony canal in the skull through which the optic nerve passes.

name: small orbit
description: Reduction in size of the bony socket holding the eye.

name: small ventricles and sulci
description: Decreased size of the cerebral ventricles and sulci on brain imaging.

name: solitary collapsed vertebra
description: A single vertebra that appears compacted or flattened on imaging.

name: solitary intracranial calcification
description: A single calcified area within the skull, often detected incidentally.

name: solitary osteolytic skull lesion
description: A single area of bone loss or destruction in the skull.

name: spina bifida aperta
description: Open type of neural tube defect where the backbone and spinal canal do not close before birth.

name: spina bifida occulta
description: A mild form of spina bifida where the spine does not close properly but no nerve tissue protrudes.

name: spinal block
description: Impediment to the flow of spinal fluid, indicating an obstruction.

name: spinal osteopenia
description: Decreased bone density in the vertebrae without fractures.

name: spool-shaped vertebrae
description: Vertebrae that have a narrowed middle region shaped like a spool.

name: squaring of vertebral body
description: Vertebral bodies that appear squared off rather than rectangular or rounded.

name: subclavian steal syndrome
description: Condition where blood flow reverses in the vertebral artery due to subclavian artery occlusion.

name: subdural empyema
description: Infection with pus accumulation in the subdural space.

name: subependymal signal void
description: Signal void near the ependyma on MR imaging, possibly indicating vascular flow or calcification.

name: subependymal tumor spread
description: Spread of tumor along the subependymal zone of the brain.

name: superior ophthalmic vein thrombosis
description: Thrombosis of the superior ophthalmic vein, often seen in orbital or cavernous sinus disease.

name: supratentorial intracranial tumor in a child
description: Tumor located in the supratentorial region of a child's brain.

name: symmetrical sacroiliac joint abnormality
description: Abnormal appearance of the sacroiliac joints on imaging, often symmetrical.

name: syringomyelia
description: Disorder characterized by the presence of a cyst or syrinx in the spinal cord.

name: T1-hyperintense diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Diffuse hyperintensity of vertebral bodies on T1-weighted MR, may indicate fatty infiltration or other processes.

name: T1-hyperintense extracranial mass
description: Mass outside the cranial cavity showing hyperintensity on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T1-hyperintense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion showing hyperintensity on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T1-hypointense brainstem lesion
description: Lesion in the brainstem appearing hypointense on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T1-hypointense diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Vertebral bodies showing diffuse hypointensity on T1-weighted MR, can indicate various pathological processes.

name: T1-hypointense extracranial mass
description: Extracranial mass showing hypointensity on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T1-hypointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion with low signal intensity on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T1-isointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion that appears isointense to normal brain tissue on T1-weighted MR imaging.

name: T2-hyperintense gyriform cortical lesion
description: Cortical lesion exhibiting high signal on T2-weighted MR imaging, often gyriform in appearance.

name: T2-hyperintense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion with high signal intensity on T2-weighted MR imaging.

name: T2-hypointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion presenting with low signal intensity on T2-weighted MR imaging.

name: T2-isointense intracranial lesion
description: Intracranial lesion that appears isointense compared to normal brain on T2-weighted MR imaging.

name: tall vertebrae
description: Vertebrae that are abnormally increased in height.

name: tam-o-shanter skull
description: Descriptive term for cranial shape resembling a tam-o-shanter cap, often in conditions like rickets or thalassemia.

name: temporal bone neoplasm
description: A mass arising from the temporal bone, often resulting from abnormal growth of tissue.

name: thickened septum pellucidum
description: Abnormal thickening of the septum pellucidum, often an incidental finding.

name: thoracolumbar gibbus
description: A kyphotic deformity of the thoracolumbar spine leading to a humpback appearance.

name: tortuous myelographic filling defect
description: Irregular filling pattern noted during myelographic imaging, indicating a potential spinal issue.

name: trigeminal nerve lesion
description: Abnormal changes or damage affecting the trigeminal nerve, which can cause facial pain or loss of sensation.

name: trigonocephaly
description: A form of craniosynostosis, resulting in a triangular-shaped forehead due to premature fusion of the metopic suture.

name: tumor crossing an intervertebral disk
description: Neoplastic process extending across adjacent vertebral bodies.

name: unilateral small cranium
description: Asymmetrical cranial size, with one side being smaller.

name: vacuum disk phenomenon
description: Presence of gas within the intervertebral disk space, often seen in degenerative disk disease.

name: vascular sinonasal mass with flow voids
description: Mass within the sinonasal region demonstrating flow voids typical of highly vascular lesions.

name: ventricular wall nodule
description: Small nodular growths found on the wall of the brain ventricles, which could be benign or malignant.

name: vertebral anomaly
description: Any irregularity in the formation or structure of a vertebra.

name: vertebral coronal cleft
description: Presence of a cleft or split in the coronal plane of a vertebra.

name: vertebral malsegmentation
description: Abnormal spinal segmentation usually due to congenital malformations.

name: vertebral neoplasm
description: Tumor arising from or affecting vertebral bones.

name: vertebral pedicle destruction
description: Loss or deterioration of vertebral pedicle integrity, often secondary to infection or tumor.

name: vertebral pedicle sclerosis
description: Increased density and sclerosis of the vertebral pedicle, often indicative of a pathological process.

name: vertical trabeculation of vertebral body
description: Vertical striations seen within the vertebral body, which can be a normal variant or related to pathology.

name: wedged vertebra
description: Triangular deformity of a vertebra usually due to compression or abnormal growth.

name: wide intervertebral disk space
description: Broadening of the space between adjacent vertebrae, can indicate pathology or be a normal variant.

name: wide spinal canal
description: An increase in the diameter of the spinal canal, potentially making it wider than normal.
